ul.li: An user with SECURITY_ADMIN role is available in ENM system and at least two users with assigned administrator role are configured in the system with default target group ALL.
To check currently assigned role(s), select the User ID on the top right hand corner, and click View User Profile from the drop-down list. Assigned roles are displayed.
The TG1 target group is available in ENM system.

context.p: This tutorial explains how to assign to more users the Amos_administrator system role with TG1 target group.

li.xref: Repeat Steps from Step 1 to Step 9 to Assign TG1 Target Group

ol.li: Select two or more users from the users list and click Edit Profile. The Edit User Profiles page is displayed.
Click Roles and Target Groups section or click Next ->.
Select the checkbox Modify Roles and Target Groups (optional).
Select the role(s) from the list to assign to the users.
Click Service Target Group to Assign and select NONE as target group to assign and click on Apply from the Assign Service Target Groups panel.
Click Authentication section or click Next ->.
Select the checkbox Modify Authentication Mode (optional) to update the authentication mode for the users.
Select the checkbox Modify Password Ageing (optional) to update the password aging setting for the users.

Enter details for the password aging:
Select Use System Settings
or
select Customize Password Ageing and enter the related details.

info.p: Click Summary section or click Next ->. The summary of the entered changes is displayed.
Click Apply to apply the changes.
Click Finish to be redirected to users list.

step.cmd: Repeat Steps from Step 1 to Step 8 to Assign TG1 Target Group

info.p: Repeat all steps from 1 to 9 to assign TG1 target group to system roles for the selected users. The only difference is that from the Assign Service Target Groups panel the TG1 target group has to be selected instead of NONE for step 6.
For more information on editing more user profiles, see the Edit Multiple Users.
